New Records: The Yankees fell out of first place in the AL East for the first time since Aug. 20.
Carlos Rodon had a season-high 11 strikeouts but did not get the win.
Clay Holmes blew his league-leading 11th save of the season.
Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford delivered a walk-off grand slam in the ninth inning to seal the Rangers' win.
DJ LeMahieu committed a fielding error in the eighth inning which led to a two-run rally by the Rangers.
The game's outcome was a turning point in the Yankees' standings as they dropped to second place.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed frustration over the loss and the bullpen's performance.
Carlos Rodon reflected on the game's cruelty and expressed confidence in Clay Holmes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees had their fifth loss in the last seven games.
The game marked the Yankees' 10th straight rubber game.
